titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Laurence E. Strong was Professor of Chemistry at Kalamazoo College and Earlham College, and Director of the Chemical Bond Approach Project. The Chemical Bond Approach (CBA) was one of the major revisions to teaching of high school chemistry which emerged from the curriculum reform movement of the 1950s. The CBA Project's goal was to develop a high school chemistry curriculum that combined experimentation with theory.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains editions of CBA texts, revision notes, correspondence about revisions, a notebook from and correspondence about a Reed College conference on the teaching of high school chemistry, and correspondence with M. Kent Wilson. The collection also includes two boxes of bound reports from the Harvard Blood Plasma studies. These were directed by Edwin J. Cohn of the Department of Physical Chemistry, Harvard Medical School, and the National Research Council during World War II.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Chemical Heritage Foundation: Chemical Bond Approach Project records (06:061); Chemical Education Material Study and Chemical Bond Approach Project records (97:03); Joseph S. Schmuckler papers (05:073); Frank Henry Verhoek papers (includes some CBA) (96:03).
